fields.Title: Chapters One and Two: Pandemic Modernity
fields.Description/Abstract:
During my sabbatical in Spring 2014, I was able to complete one and a half chapters of my book manuscript. Chapter one, “The Male Body and the Ill Male in the Heart of Darkness and The Nigger of the ‘Narcissus’” requires further research on the latter text but is otherwise finished. The second chapter, “Snowfields: ‘On Being Ill’ and a Female Artist in Woolf’s The Voyage Out and H.D.’s HERmione”) has been useful in reaching out to the Woolf scholarship committee. The publication of Jane Elizabeth Fisher’s book Envisioning Disease, Gender, and War: Women’s Narratives of the 1918 Influenza Pandemic, which I praised in the journal Modernism/Modernity in 2013, is one of the first books to focus on the pandemic in literature and let me to begin a correspondence with her over the summer. Our dialogue helped me to reconsider the scope of my book project and redraft its introduction.  

Role:  Principal
